page.title: 02St. Agnes: The creative side
page.content: In Churchtown the "Pins and Needles" shop has hand-knitted garments made by local people and a range of hand-sewn items - especially in baby wear. The walls of the Cuckoo House Restaurant are adorned with paintings done by many accomplished local artists, many of whom acquired their skills by attending art classes at the W.I. Hall. Mithian has its own studio run by Sonia Fynn. In Vicarage Road, John Vasey runs his pottery at the side of his house. Here the potter's wheel attracts many tourists. Many items take the shape of the local engine houses! Also in Vicarage Road, Giftcraft displays a wide selection of hand-made goods and soft toys such as seals, rag dolls, corn dollies and peg dollies; together with a selection of jewellery. All items are made locally.
